Posts.Content: joanne32 wrote: Hey I started this trial 2 weeks ago - i have 2 lots of erirubicin (spelt right i hope) The first lots was ok - i was nevous to begin with - i was sick 3 times and had a cracking headache for about 4 days This time (2nd) i was sick once but have been feeling very tired and now i have a sore chest when i breath (i have been for xray and bloods today - so fingers crossed all will be well My hiar has started to thin and fall out - i am not looking forward to it at all - my onc said it would be all out by today so i am not going to shave it off just yet Its crap it is but we will get throught it - i would like to hear from people on this trial (i live in the UK) Hugs J xxx Joanne32 Dx 4/29/2008, ILC, 2cm, Stage II, 1/17 nodes, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Trial - TACT 2 - is anyone else on this??? joanne32 joanne32

Posts.Content: Jul 4, 2008 09:28AM joanne32 wrote: Hi you guys Thank you so much for responding - Its nice to know that we are not alone hey... Just got my day through for starting my Chemo - (18th July) - so i am gonna make the most of this weekend and the next  - I am going to taking part in the Tact 2 trial - dont know if you have heard of it or not - (different trusts i would imagine) - cant for the life of me thisk of the drugs though as i have given the info to my ma and pa to read through - all i can really remember is that i have it every 2 wks for 4 lots (injection form) then i go onto tablets for another 4 lots but every three weeks - i also got a shot of a drus (which again i cant remember) to boost my white cells up as its every 2 weeks and not the norm 3. I have heard that you do get a crap taste in your mouth and tiredness , all i can do is wait hey - Thanks for my hugs they made me feel better!!!! (((((((((hugs back))))))) I will keep you posted on how i am coping - even if i am having a crap day Thanks again J xxxxxx
Posts.Title: Tact 2 Chemo - Starting it in a couple of weeks joanne32 Jule

Posts.Content: joanne32 wrote: Hi I am new to this so please bare with me I was diagnosed with Breast Cancer (age 32) on the 29th April 08 I have had my surgery and i am waiting for a date to start my Chemo - i am not looking foward to it at all - i have been very positive over the last 2 months, but now i am starting to feel scared and "WHY ME" thoughts - Can somebody please tell me how they felt on receiving their first chemo and how quickly did you loose your hair - so not looking forward to that at all!!! I have 2 daughters aged 9 and 3 - i want to be strong for them and my husband (who can i just say has been amazing) Looking forward to talking to others J Joanne32 Dx 4/29/2008, ILC, 2cm, Stage II, 1/17 nodes, ER+, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tact 2 Chemo - Starting it in a couple of weeks joanne32 Jule
